companies.name: Flipkart
companies.description: India's largest e-commerce marketplace for electronics, fashion, and lifestyle products
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Acquired by American retail giant Walmart in 2018, making it foreign-controlled despite Indian origins
companies.impact: One of the largest e-commerce acquisitions globally, reduced Indian ownership in the domestic e-commerce sector

companies.name: Paytm
companies.description: Digital payments, financial services, and e-commerce platform
companies.currentOwnership: Ant Group (~25%), SoftBank, other foreign investors hold majority
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Significant foreign ownership from Chinese (Ant Group/Alibaba) and Japanese (SoftBank) investors, though founder retains some control
companies.impact: Strategic control influenced by foreign investors, raised concerns about data security and national interests

companies.name: MakeMyTrip
companies.description: Online travel booking platform for flights, hotels, and holiday packages
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Merged with Chinese travel giant Ctrip (Trip.com), which became the largest shareholder
companies.impact: India's leading travel platform now controlled by Chinese interests

companies.name: Ola Cabs
companies.currentOwnership: SoftBank (~45%), founders retain control but significant foreign ownership
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: While founders maintain operational control, SoftBank and other foreign investors hold majority stake
companies.impact: Significant foreign investment diluted Indian ownership, though still considered Indian-controlled

companies.name: Swiggy
companies.description: Food delivery and quick commerce platform
companies.founders: Sriharsha Majety, Nandan Reddy, Rahul Jaimini
companies.currentOwnership: Prosus (~33%), SoftBank, other foreign investors hold majority
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Majority owned by foreign investment firms, though founders retain operational control
companies.impact: Foreign investors control majority stake in India's leading food delivery platform

companies.name: Zomato
companies.description: Food delivery, dining, and restaurant discovery platform
companies.acquirerCountry: India (Info Edge is Indian), China, USA
companies.currentOwnership: Info Edge (~18%), Ant Group, Uber, public shareholders
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Significant foreign ownership from Ant Group (China) and other international investors, though publicly traded in India
companies.impact: Mixed ownership with both Indian and foreign stakeholders, concerns over Chinese investment

companies.name: PolicyBazaar
companies.description: Online insurance aggregator and comparison platform
companies.founders: Yashish Dahiya, Alok Bansal, Avaneesh Nirjar
companies.currentOwnership: SoftBank, foreign investors hold significant stake, publicly traded
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Substantial foreign investor ownership, though publicly listed in India
companies.impact: Foreign investment firms control significant portion of India's largest insurance marketplace

companies.name: Byju's
companies.description: EdTech platform offering online learning and test preparation
companies.acquiredBy: General Atlantic, Sequoia, Tiger Global, Qatar Investment Authority
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Majority owned by American and Middle Eastern investment firms
companies.impact: India's most valuable edtech startup heavily foreign-funded, facing financial challenges

companies.name: PhonePe
companies.description: Digital payments and financial services platform
companies.founders: Sameer Nigam, Rahul Chari, Burzin Engineer
companies.whyNotSwadeshi: Owned by American retail giant Walmart after Flipkart acquisition and subsequent separation
companies.impact: One of India's leading UPI platforms controlled by foreign entity, raising data sovereignty concerns

meta.note: This list includes Indian-origin companies with significant foreign ownership or control.
